benchmark_details.name: MedHEval
benchmark_details.overview: MedHEval is a benchmark designed to systematically evaluate hallucinations and mitigation strategies in medical large vision-language models (Med-LVLMs) by categorizing hallucinations into three underlying causes: visual misinterpretation, knowledge deficiency, and context misalignment.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To establish a standardized framework for evaluating and mitigating medical hallucinations, guiding the development of more trustworthy Med-LVLMs.

data.source: Comprises diverse medical datasets including SLAKE, VQA-RAD, IU-Xray, MIMIC-CXR, and MIMIC-IV.
data.format: VQA pairs generated as close-ended and open-ended questions
data.annotation: Automatically annotated using various medical benchmarks.

methodology.calculation: Evaluation based on accuracy and hallucination metrics
methodology.interpretation: Higher accuracy indicates better performance in resisting hallucinations.

ethical_and_legal_considerations.privacy_and_anonymity: Data source ensures privacy for participants through de-identification.
ethical_and_legal_considerations.data_licensing: All datasets are publicly available under defined licenses.
ethical_and_legal_considerations.compliance_with_regulations: Adheres to ethical standards in medical data usage.
